alert.note: Alert for Coastal Miami Dade County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued November 09 at 4:14AM EST until November 10 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following areas, Coastal Broward, Coastal Miami-Dade, Coastal Palm Beach, Glades, Hendry, Inland Broward, Inland Palm Beach, Metro Broward, Metro Miami-Dade and Metro Palm Beach. * WHEN...Through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall from Tropical Storm Nicole will overspread portions of South Florida today into Thursday. Storm total amounts of 2-4 inches with localized amounts in excess of 6 inches are possible through early Thursday afternoon with the highest amounts expected over northern portions of the area. This could lead to some instances of flooding across the area, especially in urban and poor drainage areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
